page.title: 11A Factory in the Country
page.content: Nicholson's Plastic Factory is half a mile west of the village, and is a medium-sized brick building. Mr.A.A.Nicholson owns the factory which has been his for about fourteen years. It is a family business. He has other businesses in Liverpool and Surrey. The chemicals he uses are polyester resin, catalysts and fibre glass. From these chemicals, he makes water tanks for domestic and hotel use, and Baptismal tanks. He exports some of his goods to the Middle East, and he also sells his goods all over Britain. Mr. Nicholson has a workforce of thirty-five. The small tanks are painted by hand but the big tanks are sprayed. It is an old Victorian factory which used to make chenille cloth.
